description: Savor the creamy goodness of Loaded Baked Potato Soup, topped with crispy bacon and melty cheese. Perfect for chilly evenings or as a hearty starter!
ingredients: 4 large russet potatoes, peeled and diced
instructions: In a large pot, combine the diced potatoes, onion, celery, carrots, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Reduce heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Using a potato masher, mash the potatoes slightly to thicken the soup.
Stir in the heavy cream, cheddar cheese, and crumbled bacon. Cook until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with green onions.
tips: For a creamier texture, blend a portion of the soup before adding the cream. Ensure potatoes are cut evenly for uniform cooking. Adjust seasoning after adding cheese for best flavor.

Initial Setup:
In a large pot, combine the diced potatoes, onion, celery, carrots, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.

Reduce heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Using a potato masher, mash the potatoes slightly to thicken the soup.

Stir in the heavy cream, cheddar cheese, and crumbled bacon. Cook until the cheese is melted and the soup is heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot, garnished with green onions.

note.label: Essential Knowledge
note.content:
• For a thicker soup, blend a portion of it before adding cream
  • Avoid overcooking the vegetables to maintain texture
  • The soup is done when the potatoes are tender and creamy
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days

structured_content.content: Sharing this Loaded Baked Potato Soup with family always brings smiles. It's a reminder that comfort food can be simple yet satisfying, perfect for cozy evenings together.
Add a sprinkle of smoked paprika for a hint of smokiness, or stir in some sour cream for extra creaminess. Fresh herbs like thyme or rosemary can elevate the flavor profile.
Serve with crusty bread for dipping or a side salad for a complete meal. A sprinkle of extra cheese on top enhances the experience.
Substitute heavy cream with half-and-half for a lighter version. For a vegetarian option, replace chicken broth with vegetable broth and omit bacon.
